text: Frank Morrison Spillane (; March 9, 1918July 17, 2006), better known as Mickey Spillane, was an American crime novelist and actor. He was best known for his Mike Hammer novels. More than 225 million copies of his books have sold internationally.William L DeAndrea, Encyclopedia Mysteriosa : a comprehensive guide to the art of detection in print, film, radio, and television. New York: Prentice Hall General Reference, 1994. (pp. 336-7). He was born in New York City. Spillane died on July 17, 2006 in Murrells Inlet, South Carolina of pancreatic cancer, aged 88. ==References== Category:1918 births Category:2006 deaths Category:Crime writers Category:American novelists Category:American television actors Category:Actors from New York City Category:Writers from New York City
title: Mickey Spillane
